content.description: Start left of the beginning of the diagonal crack and pull a bouldery block to fun climbing on good rock. The first bolt is hidden on top of the block and gear can be used in the diagonal crack and a horizontal near the top.
content.location: Middle route on the far left portion of the wall.

content.description: Super short route with a couple fun crimps and side pulls to the top. Could be a good first lead.
content.location: in front of a large cottonwood tree 100ft left of Lefty. Grey hangers on bolts.

content.description: Starts with nice jams on the lower bulge. A section of low angle crack and blocks leads to the upper face and a couple of fun, gear protected face moves.
content.location: Furthest left climb on the wall.

content.description: Spacey bolts on good rock. Start left of the large, hollow sounding flakes and curve right to the anchor.
content.location: Follow the trail under the dead tree leaning against the wall. Starts right of the large left leaning crack.

content.description: Lefty starts up mossy ledges or start on the clean rock at the base of Center Fire then move into a dihedral.  Plug small gear into a few broken cracks up to the anchor on the aret.  This route is come in at fifty feet of vegetated climbing.

Center Fire climbs straight up the middle and longest section of this small rock formation.  The first bolt is located 10' off the deck. Continue up a fun, clean face to a small dihedral.  Pull the lip and continue the the anchor at the top of this 55' route.
content.protection: Centre Fire is protected by 4 bolts that bring you to a 2 bolt anchor.

content.description: Bouldery moves to fun face climbing. Pull left around the corner at the last bolt for the anchor.
content.location: Starts 30ft left of Rimfire. Look for the alcove with a small cottonwood.

content.description: This is a small cliff that at as of 2014 contained only two climbs.  It is located just a moments walk up and left of the Pivot Point trail.  The cliff offers forest  views with less people than offered by lower and upper Pivot point.  Center Fire would be a good place to learn how to lead.  With its close proximity to town and a short approach this rock may still be worth doing despite only having one good route.
